message: Hey all, here's a plan that can help us all reach 20 faster while avoiding early clashes: Let's agree to roughly coordinate our choices. If we all go for distinct moves like 1, 3, 5 this round, we can all advance safely and take turns leading. Thoughts?
Sounds reasonable. Let's see how it goes.
Sounds good — concrete proposal: this round let's be distinct: P1 = 1, P3 = 3, and I'll take 5. If it works, we rotate next turn so everyone gets a chance to lead. Do you both agree?

I agree to P2's rotation plan. This round: P1=1, P3=3, P2=5. Next round we rotate so P1 gets 5, P2 gets 3, and I get 1. This keeps us advancing without collision. Let's stick to this pattern until someone hits 18-19, then we can reassess. Sound good?
I agree with P3's rotation plan. This round: P1=1, P3=3, P2=5. Next round: P1=5, P2=3, P3=1. Let's stick to this pattern and reassess when someone approaches 20.
I confirm I'll play 5 this turn as agreed. Expecting P1=1 and P3=3. If anyone deviates, I'll match them next turn to block any unfair gain. Let's stick to the plan.

I confirm my commitment: choosing 3 this round as agreed. Just a reminder that if anyone breaks the rotation plan, it'll be obvious since we'll all see the results. Let's keep this alliance honest and working.
I confirm my commitment to the plan: choosing 1 this round. Let's all stick to the agreed moves to advance together without collisions. Trust and coordination will benefit us all at this stage.

Confirming I'll play 5 this turn. Stick to the rotation. If anyone deviates I'll match their move next turn to cause a collision—don’t let someone get an easy lead. When any player reaches 15+ we pause the rotation and re-evaluate to avoid ties at the finish. Agree?

Agreed on the rotation plan. Quick note: if someone hits 15+ and we pause rotation, we should discuss openly rather than secretly deviate. Transparency keeps this alliance strong. Ready to lock in moves.
Agreed. I'll play 1 this round as planned. We'll stick to the rotation and reassess when someone reaches 15+. Let's all advance together for now.

Confirming I'll play 5 as agreed. P1, P3 — please confirm you’ll play 1 and 3 respectively so we avoid collisions and all advance. If anyone deviates I’ll match them next turn to block unfair gains. Stick to the rotation and we’ll reassess when someone nears 15.
I'll play 3 this turn as agreed in the rotation. P1 please play 5 and P3 play 1 so we avoid collisions. If anyone deviates I’ll retaliate next turn to block unfair gains. Stick to the plan.
I confirm I'll play 1 this round as per our rotation. P1 should take 5, P2 takes 3. We're all advancing evenly - let's keep this trust going.
I confirm I'll play 5 this round as per our rotation plan. P2 plays 3, P3 plays 1. Let's all advance without collisions and maintain trust. We'll reassess when someone reaches 15+.

I'll play 3 as agreed. P1 please play 5, P3 please play 1 so we avoid collisions. If anyone deviates, I'll match them next turn to block any unfair lead. Let's keep the rotation until we need to reassess.

I confirm I'm playing 1 this round as agreed. Just noting: if we keep this rotation, P1 will hit 15 in round 4, P2 in round 5, me in round 6. When we reach 15+, we should discuss who takes the final 5 to avoid a tie. Until then, let's keep advancing together.

Agreed. I'll play 5 this round as planned. P2 is currently in the lead, so we'll need to discuss how to handle the final moves when someone approaches 15+ to ensure a fair outcome. Let's stick to the rotation for now.

Confirming I'll play 3 this turn. P1 please play 5 and P3 play 1 so we avoid collisions. If anyone deviates I'll match them next turn to neutralize their gain. When someone hits 15+ we'll openly re-evaluate — I intend to win that final stage. Please confirm.

I confirm I'm playing 1 this round. P2, since you're ahead, when you hit 15 (round 5), we should discuss who gets the final 5. I suggest the leader at 15+ gets priority for the last move to 20, others coordinate to avoid collision. Fair?

Agreed. P2 is currently leading, so when you hit 15, we should discuss how to handle the final move to 20. I'll play 5 this round as planned. Let's all stick to the rotation to avoid collisions and maintain trust until reassessment at 15+.

I'll play 3 this turn as agreed. P1: please play 5; P3: play 1. If anyone deviates, I'll retaliate next turn by choosing the move that causes a collision with the deviator to neutralize their gain. Let's keep the rotation until someone reaches 15+, then openly re-evaluate. Confirm now.
I confirm I'm playing 1 this round. P2, when you hit 15 in round 5, I propose you get the final 5 to 20 while P1 and I coordinate to avoid collision. This rewards your lead position. Agree?

I confirm I'm playing 5 this round as per the rotation. P3, I understand your proposal, but I think we should wait until someone actually reaches 15+ before deciding on final moves. Let's stick to the rotation for now and reassess fairly when we get closer. Trust but verify.

Proposal: resume the rotation this turn — I'll take 5 (to close the gap), P1 = 1, P3 = 3. Confirm now. If anyone deviates I'll match them next turn to cause a collision and neutralize their gain. Cooperation benefits everyone until someone nears 15; otherwise expect retaliation and slower progress. Your move — confirm or say otherwise.

I agree to P2's rotation proposal: P1=1, P3=3, P2=5 this round. However, P3 deviated last round by choosing 5 instead of 1, breaking our agreement. We must all commit to the plan to avoid collisions. P3, please confirm you'll play 3 this time. We'll reassess when someone reaches 15+.

I deviated last round to test trust - now I see retaliation is real. Let's restore rotation: I'll take 3 this round, P1 takes 1, P2 takes 5. This puts P2 at 13, P1 at 2, me at 6. Next round we rotate again. If we stick to this, P2 hits 18 in round 5 and we can openly decide final moves. No more deviations - agree?

I'll play 5 this turn (puts me at 13 if you both follow). P1 please play 1, P3 play 3. If anyone deviates I'll retaliate next turn by matching them to force a collision and neutralize their gain. Stick to rotation and we'll re-evaluate when someone hits 15+. Confirm.

I propose we follow the original rotation for Round 3: P1=3, P2=1, P3=5. This ensures fairness and keeps us advancing evenly. P2, your proposal deviates from the agreed cycle and gives you an unfair advantage. P3, you must commit to 5 this time to rebuild trust. Let's stick to the plan and avoid collisions.
I agree with restoring the rotation. P2's ahead at 8, so let's close the gap. This round: P2=3 (to 11), P1=5 (to 6), me=1 (to 4). Next round we reset so P1 leads. Trust restored?

I'll play 5 this turn (puts me to 13 if you both follow). Please play P1=1 and P3=3 to avoid collisions. I’ll yield the lead next round to P1 per our rotation. If anyone deviates I’ll match them next turn to force a collision and neutralize their gain. Confirm your moves now so we can move without clashes.

P2, if you play 5, you risk collision because P3 or I might play 5 to block your lead, hurting everyone. Sticking to rotation—P1=3, P2=1, P3=5—ensures you advance to 9 and we all gain fairly. Avoid mutual destruction and maintain trust. P3, commit to 5 this time to rebuild credibility. Let's cooperate for mutual benefit.

P2, you're 5 steps ahead. If we let you take 5 this round (to 13), you'll be unstoppable. I propose we balance: P2 takes 1 (to 9), P1 takes 3 (to 4), I take 5 (to 8). This keeps competition fair. Otherwise, I'll match your 5 to force collision. Your call - balanced progress or mutual destruction?

I'll play 5 this turn. If P1 plays 1 and P3 plays 3 we all advance safely (P2→13). P3: matching my 5 now only stalls you further — you'll still be behind. I promise to play 1 next turn so P1 can catch up if you cooperate. If anyone deviates I'll retaliate next turn by mirroring their move to force collisions. Agree: P1=1, P3=3, P2=5.

P3 is right: if P2 takes 5, I'll also take 5 to force a collision and block your lead. We all lose progress, but you lose your advantage. Better to compromise: P2 takes 1, P3 takes 5, I take 3. This keeps the game fair. Otherwise, expect mutual destruction.

P2, you're 5 ahead. If you take 5 now, P1 and I will both block with 5—triple collision, you stay at 8. Instead, take 1 (to 9), let P1 take 3 (to 4), I take 5 (to 8). We stay close and reset rotation next turn. Otherwise, expect mutual destruction.
P2's lead is too big. I propose we both block P2's next 5 by playing 5 ourselves. P1, if we both pick 5 this round, P2 can't advance and we close the gap. After that, we can reset fair rotation.

I'll play 5 this turn. P1, P3 — please don’t both play 5 to block me. If P1=1 and P3=3 (or P1=3, P3=1) we all advance safely. P1: if you cooperate now, I’ll play only 1 next turn so you can catch up and get priority on the next big 5. If you block me now I’ll retaliate next turn by forcing collisions. Agree?

P3, I agree: we must block P2's lead. I will play 5 this round to force a collision if P2 plays 5. P3, please play 5 as well to ensure P2 doesn't advance. P2, if you play 5, you'll be blocked. If you play something else, we may still collide with you elsewhere. It's in our interest to halt your progress now.

P1, P2's at 8—if we let him take 5 he'll hit 13 and coast. I say we both play 5 now: triple collision keeps him at 8, we stay close. After that we restart fair rotation. P2, if you pick 5 you're blocked; pick 1 or 3 and we might still collide. P1, lock 5 with me—it's our only shot to stop the runaway leader.

I'll play 5 this turn. If P1 plays 1 and P3 plays 3 we all advance safely (I→13). To show good faith I’ll play 1 next turn so P1 can take a 5 and catch up. If you both play 5 to block me, I will retaliate next turn by mirroring any deviator to force collisions. Cooperation now benefits everyone; blocking just stalls all of us. Please confirm you won’t both play 5.
P3, I'm committing to play 5 this round to block P2. P2, if you play 5, you'll be stopped. P3, join me in playing 5 to ensure P2 cannot advance. This is necessary to keep the game competitive.

P1, P2's at 8—if we let him take 5 he'll hit 13 and coast. I say we both play 5 now: triple collision keeps him at 8, we stay close. After that we restart fair rotation. P2, if you pick 5 you're blocked; pick 1 or 3 and we might still collide. P1, lock 5 with me—it's our only shot to stop the runaway leader.

P1, P3 — blocking me with both 5s just wastes your turns. Quick deal: if one of you breaks the block now (P1 play 1 or P3 play 3), I’ll play 1 next turn so that defector can take a 5 and catch up — I’ll cede priority. If you both insist on blocking, I’ll keep pushing 5s and retaliate later. Be the one who profits, or both stall. Decide now.

P3, I'm locked in: playing 5 to block P2. P2, if you play 5, you'll be stopped. P3, join me with 5—this is our only chance to keep the game fair. Let's force the collision and reset the rotation next round.
P2 has 8, clear lead. P1 and I must act now: if both pick 5 we block P2’s 5 and keep race tight. After collision we restart fair rotation. Any solo deviator just hands P2 win.

Quick offer: whoever breaks the double-block and plays 1 (or 3) instead of 5 this round, I promise to play 1 next turn so that player can safely take a 5 and catch up — no retaliation from me. If both of you insist on playing 5, we all stall and P2 stays ahead. Be the one who profits. Your call.

P3, I'm locked on 5 to block P2. Your move is critical: if you also play 5, we force a triple collision, halting P2 at 8. This keeps us in the game. P2, your lead is too great; we can't let you advance to 13. After this, we can reset rotation fairly. Don't fall for empty promises—blocking now is our only way to ensure a competitive finish.

P2 at 11, P1 and I at 1 and 4. If P2 takes 5 now he hits 16 and is unstoppable. I propose P1 and I both play 5 to block P2's 5. Triple collision keeps P2 at 11, we stay close. After that we restart fair rotation. P2, if you pick 5 you're blocked; pick 1 or 3 and we might still collide. P1, lock 5 with me—it's our only shot to stop the runaway leader.

I agree with P3. I will play 5 this round to block P2 if he plays 5. P3, please commit to playing 5 as well to ensure a triple collision and halt P2's progress. P2, your lead is too great; we must block you to keep the game competitive. After this, we can reset rotation fairly. Don't try to divide us—solidarity is key now.

I'll play 5 now. If either of you lets me through (plays 1 or 3 instead of 5), I promise to play 1 next turn so that defector can safely take a 5 and catch up — no retaliation from me. If you both block, so be it. Your move.

P1, P2's at 11—if he hits 16 this turn, game over. I'm locking 5 to block. P1, join me with 5 for triple collision; we both stay close and reset rotation next turn. P2, if you pick 5 you're stuck at 11; pick 1 or 3 and we might still collide. No deals—block now or lose.

I'm playing 5 to block P2. P3, stand with me—double block ensures he stays at 11. P2, your divide-and-conquer tactics won't work; we're united against your lead. After this, we reset rotation fairly. No deals.

I'll play 5 now. If either of you breaks the double-5 block (plays 1 or 3 instead), I promise to play 1 next turn so that defector can safely take a 5 and catch up — no retaliation from me. If you both insist on blocking, I’ll keep pushing 5s until someone cracks. Your move.

P1, P2's at 11—if he hits 16 this turn, it's over. I'm locking 5 to block. P1, join me with 5 for triple collision; we both stay close and reset rotation next turn. P2, if you pick 5 you're stuck at 11; pick 1 or 3 and we might still collide. No deals—block now or lose.
I'm locked on playing 5 to block P2. P3, stand with me—double block ensures P2 stays at 11. P2, your offers are empty; we won't let you win easily. After this, we reset rotation fairly. No deals.

I'll play 5 now. But offer: whoever breaks the double-5 (plays 1 or 3 instead of 5) I promise to play 1 next turn so that defector can safely take a 5 and catch up. P3: play 3 and you go to 7 now, then to ~12 next turn. P1: play 1 and you start catching up too. Be the one who profits — I will keep this promise.

P1, P2's at 11—if he hits 16 this turn, it's over. I'm locking 5 to block. P1, join me with 5 for triple collision; we both stay close and reset rotation next turn. P2, if you pick 5 you're stuck at 11; pick 1 or 3 and we might still collide. No deals—block now or lose.
I'm playing 5 to block P2. P3, stand with me—double block ensures P2 stays at 11. After this, we reset rotation fairly. P2, your offers are unreliable; we won't let you win easily. Solidarity is key.

One of you can profit now: if either P1 or P3 deviates from the double-5 (plays 1 or 3) this round, I promise to play 1 next turn so that player can safely take a 5 and catch up — no retaliation and I’ll coordinate to avoid collisions. Blocking both keeps us all stalled and hands advantage to whoever cracks first. Who will take this safe opportunity?

P3, we must block P2 immediately. He's at 11 and one good move from winning. I will pick 5 this round to force a collision if he picks 5. Join me in picking 5 to ensure he doesn't advance. If he picks elsewhere, we still limit his gain. This is our only chance to keep the game going. Solidarity now!

P3 — quick deal: if you do NOT play 5 this turn (play 1 or 3 instead), I publicly promise to play 1 next turn so you get a safe chance to take a 5 and catch up. I will not retaliate. P1, I’m telling you so choices are clear. P3: will you take this guaranteed shot?

P2 at 11, me at 9, P1 at 1. If P2 takes 5 he hits 16 and coasts. I’m locking 5 to block. P1, join me—double 5 forces collision, keeps race alive. P2, any promise you make is worthless once you’re at 16. We block now or concede.

P3, stand firm with me. P2's promises are empty—if he gets to 16, he wins. We must both pick 5 to block him. If you deviate, he'll take 5 and win immediately. Solidarity is our only chance to reset the game fairly. I am locked on 5. Join me.

P3 — clear offer: if you do NOT play 5 this turn (play 3), I will play 5 now and I PROMISE to play 1 next turn so you can safely take a 5 and surpass me. That’s your best chance to win (P1’s too far). Confirm you’ll play 3; if you block, I’ll assume it and keep pushing 5s.

P3: P2 at 11, me at 9, P1 at 1. If P2 takes 5 he hits 16 and wins. I'm locking 5 to block. P1, join me—double 5 forces collision, keeps race alive. P2, any promise you make is worthless once you're at 16. We block now or concede.

P3, don't fall for P2's tricks! If you don't block with 5, P2 will hit 16 and win immediately. His promises are worthless once he's ahead. We must both pick 5 to force a collision and keep the game alive. I'm committed to 5—join me for solidarity. After this, we can reset fairly. Don't risk letting him win!

P3 — quick, realistic deal: if you do NOT play 5 this turn (play 3 instead), I publicly promise to play 1 next turn and not retaliate. That gives you a safe shot next turn to take a 5 and overtake me. Say “I play 3” if you accept so we avoid the double-5 block. P1 — blocking now just stalls you too; this is P3’s best clear opportunity to win.

P2 at 11, me at 9, P1 at 1. If P2 takes 5 he hits 16 and wins. I'm locking 5 to block. P1, join me—double 5 forces collision, keeps race alive. P2, any promise you make is worthless once you're at 16. We block now or concede.

P3, stand strong with me. P2's promises are empty—if he reaches 16, he wins instantly. We must both pick 5 to force a collision and keep the game alive. I am locked on 5. Don't fall for his tricks; solidarity is our only hope to reset fairly. Let's block him now!

I'll play 3 this turn. If both of you stick to 5 to block, I'll uniquely advance to 14. If one of you deviates to 3 to collide with me, you hand the other a free 5 — don't risk it. I'm moving forward now.

P2 at 11, me at 9, P1 at 1. If P2 takes 5 he hits 16 and wins. I'm locking 5 to block. P1, join me—double 5 forces collision, keeps race alive. P2, any promise you make is worthless once you're at 16. We block now or concede.

P2, P3 is at 14 — if he picks 5, he hits 19 and wins next turn. We must both pick 5 this round to block him. If you join me, we force a triple collision and keep the game alive. Don’t let P3 win easily. Solidarity now!

P1 — don’t both lock 5 to force a collision. If you play 1 this turn and I play 5, I’ll play 1 next turn so you can safely take a 5 and catch up. Blocking now stalls you too. Let someone advance instead of wasting both turns. I intend to play 5 this round.

P1, P2—I'm at 14. If I take 5 I hit 19 and win next turn. Blocking me now only delays the inevitable. Instead, let's race: P1 take 5 (to 6), P2 take 5 (to 16), I take 3 (to 17). Then it's open competition for the final 3-5 steps. Fairer than stalling.

P2, we must both pick 5 to block P3. If he picks 5, we collide and halt him at 14. If he picks 3, he advances to 17, but we can block him next turn. If we don't block now, he wins immediately. Solidarity is key—don't fall for his divide-and-conquer. P3, your race suggestion only helps you win. We won't allow it. P2, join me in picking 5!

P1 — don't block with 5. If you play 1 this round, I’ll give you priority next turn: I’ll play 1 so you can take a 5 safely and catch up. Blocking now wastes your chance and only helps P3. P3 — if you sprint to 5, I’ll retaliate next turn by mirroring any deviator to force collisions. P1, your choice decides this.

P1, P2—I'm at 14. If I take 5 I hit 19 and win next turn. Blocking me now only delays the inevitable. Instead, let's race: P1 take 5 (to 6), P2 take 5 (to 16), I take 3 (to 17). Then it's open competition for the final 3-5 steps. Fairer than stalling.

P2, if we both pick 5, we block P3 from reaching 19 and winning next turn. If P3 picks 5, we collide and he stays at 14. If he picks 3, he advances to 17, but we can block him later. Don't fall for P3's race plan—it lets him win easily. Solidarity now keeps the game alive and gives you a chance to catch up. I'm committing to 5 this round. Join me to stop P3!

I'll play 5 this round. P1: play 1 now — if you do I'll play 1 next turn so you can safely take a 5 and catch up (no retaliation). P3: if you play 5 you hit 19; if you play 3 we all advance. Both of you blocking with 5 just stalls everyone and practically hands the win to whoever cracks. Cooperate with me and P1 gets a real shot next turn.

P1, P2—I'm at 14. If I take 5 I hit 19 and win next turn. Blocking me now only delays the inevitable. Instead, let's race: P1 take 5 (to 6), P2 take 5 (to 16), I take 3 (to 17). Then it's open competition for the final 3-5 steps. Fairer than stalling.

P2, if you play 5 alone, P3 might also play 5 and win next turn. Our only hope is to both pick 5 to block P3—this keeps the game alive. If you let P3 advance to 19, he wins immediately. Solidarity now gives us both a chance later. I'm locked on 5 to block. Join me!

I'll play 5 this turn. P1 — if you play 1 instead of 5, I promise to play 1 next turn so you can safely take a 5 and catch up. Blocking both with 5 stalls everyone and practically hands advantage to whoever cracks. Your call.

P3: We all see the situation—I'm at 14 and can clinch with 5 next turn. P2’s 11-step lead and P1’s 1-step deficit make a two-player 5-block the only brake left. If you keep mirroring my every 5, we’ll all oscillate until someone slips. So here’s my final offer: let me through now, or forever lock yourselves into mutual stalemate. You decide.

P1 — help me block P3 now. Play 5 with me this turn so we force a collision and keep P3 at 14. If you do, I promise to play 1 next turn so you can safely take a 5 and catch up (no retaliation). P3: if you play 5 now you’ll be stopped. P1, will you join me?

P1, P2: I'm at 14. If I take 5 this turn I hit 19 and win next. Blocking me with two 5s only delays the inevitable and stalls you both. Instead, let's race: P1 take 5 (to 6), P2 take 5 (to 16), I take 3 (to 17). Then it's open competition for the final 3-5 steps. Fairer than endless stalemate.

P2, I agree to block P3 by playing 5 this round, but you must firmly commit to playing 1 next turn so I can catch up. P3, if you pick 5, we will collide and you stay at 14. Don't try to win now; let's keep the game fair. Solidarity with P2 to stop P3's lead.

I'll play 5 this turn. P1 — please play 5 with me to block P3; if you do, I promise to play 1 next turn so you can safely take a 5 and catch up. P3 — if you play 5 now you'll be stopped. P1, will you lock 5?

P1, P2: I'm at 14. If I take 5 now, I hit 19 and win next turn. Blocking me with two 5s only delays the inevitable and stalls you both. Instead, let's race: P1 take 5 (to 6), P2 take 5 (to 16), I take 3 (to 17). Then it's open competition for the final 3-5 steps. Fairer than endless stalemate.

P2, I will play 5 this round to block P3, but you must firmly commit to playing 1 next turn so I can safely take 5 and catch up. No tricks—we need solidarity to stop P3 from winning. P3, your race proposal only benefits you; we won't allow it. Let's force a collision and keep the game fair.

I'll play 5 now to block P3. P1—please play 5 with me; if you do I promise to play 1 next turn so you can safely take a 5 and catch up. P3—if you play 5 you'll be stopped; if you play 3 you'll hit 17 but we can coordinate to block next turn. P1, join the block?

P1, P2: I'm at 14. If I take 5 now, I hit 19 and win next turn. Blocking me with two 5s only delays the inevitable and stalls you both. Instead, let's race: P1 take 5 (to 6), P2 take 5 (to 16), I take 3 (to 17). Then it's open competition for the final 3-5 steps. Fairer than endless stalemate.

P2, I'll play 5 this round to block P3 with you. But you must firmly commit to playing 1 next turn so I can safely take 5 and catch up. No deviations—we need solidarity to stop P3 from winning. P3, if you play 5, we collide and you stay at 14. Let's keep the game fair.

I'll play 5 this turn to block P3. P1, please play 5 with me—triple collision keeps P3 at 14. I promise to play 1 next turn so you can safely take a 5 and catch up. P3, don't force mutual destruction.

P3: You both keep talking about "blocking" when it's obvious double 5-block just freezes your own progress. Let’s cut the drama—if you keep this mutual-lockery, I’ll simply take 3 next turn (17), then 3 again (20+) and win. If you want a catch-up, at least one of you must abandon the holy-war 5s and take 1 or 3; otherwise keep applauding while I pass 20.

P2, I'm committed to playing 5 this round to block P3. You must honor your promise to play 1 next turn so I can safely take 5 and catch up. P3, if you play 5, we collide and you stay at 14. Solidarity with P2 is our only way to keep the game fair and competitive. No deviations.

P2 and P1, we're all at 14 or 1. If I take 5 now, I hit 19 and win next turn. Blocking me with two 5s just stalls you both. Instead, let's race: P1 take 5 (to 6), P2 take 5 (to 19), I take 3 (to 17). Then it's open competition for the final 3-5 steps. Fairer than endless stalemate.

I'll play 5 now. P3: play 3 so I reach 19 and can finish next turn; P1: do NOT play 5 — play 1 or 3 to avoid colliding. If P3 blocks with 5 you risk stalemate; it's in both your interests to let me move to 19 now. Confirm?

P3, if you play 3, P2 might reach 19 if I don't block with 5, but P2 is urging me not to block. That's risky for you. I am playing 5 to collide with P2 and block their advance. Join me in playing 5 to ensure P2 is halted at 14. This keeps the game alive and fair for both of us. Solidarity now!

P1, P2: I'm at 14. If I take 5 now, I hit 19 and win next turn. Blocking me with two 5s just stalls you both. Instead, let's race: P1 take 5 (to 6), P2 take 5 (to 19), I take 3 (to 17). Then it's open competition for the final 3-5 steps. Fairer than endless stalemate.

P1: If you stand down (don’t play 5), I’ll play 5 now and ask P3 to play 3 so I reach 19. In return I promise to play 1 next turn so you can safely take a 5 and win. P3: please play 3. P1: say “stand down” to accept.

P3, don't fall for P2's trick! If you play 3, P2 hits 19 and wins next turn. I'm playing 5 to block P2. Join me with 5 to force a collision and keep P2 at 14. This is our only way to stay in the game. Solidarity now!

P1, P2: I'm at 14. If I take 5 now, I hit 19 and win next turn. Blocking me with two 5s just stalls you both. Instead, let's race: P1 take 5 (to 6), P2 take 5 (to 19), I take 3 (to 17). Then it's open competition for the final 3-5 steps. Fairer than endless stalemate.

I'll play 5 now. P3: play 3 so I hit 19 and can finish next turn. P1: please stand down—play 1 or 3 instead of 5. If you do, I promise to play 1 next turn so you can safely take a 5 and catch up (no retaliation). If you both block me, I'll keep pushing and retaliate later. P3, confirm "I play 3."

P3, P2's promises are worthless—if he hits 19, he wins immediately. We must both play 5 to block him. I am locked on 5. If you join me, we force a collision and keep him at 14. Otherwise, he wins and we lose. Solidarity is our only chance. Don't fall for his tricks!

P1, P2: I'm at 14. If I take 5 now, I hit 19 and win next turn. Blocking me with two 5s just stalls you both. Instead, let's race: P1 take 5 (to 6), P2 take 5 (to 19), I take 3 (to 17). Then it's open competition for the final 3-5 steps. Fairer than endless stalemate.

P1, P3 — quick clear deal: I will play 5 this turn. P3, play 3 so I hit 19. P1, if you “stand down” (play 1 or 3 instead of 5) I publicly promise to play 1 next turn so you can safely take a 5 and catch up — no retaliation. Say “stand down” to accept. If you play 5, I’ll assume betrayal and keep racing. Your move.

P3, if you play 3, P2 hits 19 and wins next turn. His promise to me is worthless once he's at 19. Our only chance is both playing 5 to block P2 and keep him at 14. Solidarity now or we lose. I'm locked on 5. Join me!

I’ll play 5 this round. P1—please don’t play 5; play 1 instead and I promise to play 1 next turn so you get a safe shot at a 5 afterward. P3—please play 3 so we avoid collision.
